content: I decided to make an "Claimed" column, and put issues which don't have a PR / aren't under active development there
This also replaces "Mentor assigned" column (a mentor will type out the notes and put it back in "To do")
and then moved "In progress" next to "Done" to emphasize that these have a clear path to getting done
(if they don't, they should go to "Blocked", usually)

This means we can work from "right to left" in meetings.. look at

  1. what got done
  2. what's about to get done
  3. what's blocked from getting done
  4. what's claimed but not started yet
  5. what's left to do
I might even consider moving new issue triage to the end, since it sucks up so much time from finishing what we start
even though staying on top of new issues is also important, it seems less important than keeping up our momentum
cc @nikomatsakis if you have any thoughts
I updated the Triage meetings section to reflect this, let me know what you think
